action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X
X ▢ ▢ X ▢
X X X ▢ ▢
X ▢ ▢ X ▢
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X
DESCRIPTION: 5x5 grid with Xs forming a cross shape, with an additional X in the center of the top row and the center of the bottom row.

This is my DESCRIPTION: 5x5 grid with Xs forming a cross shape, with an additional X in the center of the top row and the center of the bottom row.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any Xs outside the central cross shape in your grid?

This is my DESCRIPTION: 5x5 grid with Xs forming a cross shape, with an additional X in the center of the top row and the center of the bottom row.
QUESTION: Are there any Xs outside the central cross shape in your grid? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any additional Xs in the corners of your grid?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Are there any additional Xs in the corners of your grid? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the pattern of Xs symmetrical both vertically and horizontally in your grid?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Is the pattern of Xs symmetrical both vertically and horizontally in your grid? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Does your grid have any Xs that are not part of the central cross and the additional Xs in the center of the top and bottom rows?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Does your grid have any Xs that are not part of the central cross and the additional Xs in the center of the top and bottom rows? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are all the spaces between the Xs in your grid filled with empty squares (▢)?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Are all the spaces between the Xs in your grid filled with empty squares (▢)? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the total number of Xs in your grid 13?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Is the total number of Xs in your grid 13? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your grid and the other grid described the same?  Write "DECISION: same grid" if you think they are the same grid or "DECISION: different grids" if you think they are different grids. Do not add anything else.

ANSWER: Yes.
